projects.description: I practied basic JavaScript syntax and data structures by building a Random Quote Generator, displaying a random quote when a user clicks a button or the page auto-refreshes. Additionally, the background color changes to a random color.

This project focuses on pagination to enhance the usability of this ficional student directory. With an initial list of 42 students, this code displays only 9 students per page. Additional features include: search bar with pagination, 'no results' displayed for the user if nothing matched the search, and dynamic updating to the search results as characters are typed in the search bar.

I added JavaScript to enhance an interactive registraion form for a fictional Full Stack conference. I added validation with visual indicators, dynamic total cost updating, payment fields to update with payment type selection, field focus for keyboard navication, real-time error messaging on the name and email fields with conditional error messaging on the email field.

I created a browser-based pokemon name finder game 'Pokemon Finder.' This utilizes Object-Oriented Programming to select a random, hidden pokemon name, which a user tries to guess. Additional features include: being able to use the physical keyboard in addition to the on-screen one and personalizing the game to be pokemon-themed.

This is an employee directory for a fictional company, 'Awesome Startup'. This directory helps all the remote employees share contact information with each other. For this fictional company, this code uses the Random User Generator API (https://randomuser.me/) to grab information for 12 random “employees” and build an employee directory. Addional features include: search filter by name, toggle between employees while looking at their modal, and some CSS was updated with a background image and Lexand font.
